name: Nepal
description: Nepal, officially the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal, is a landlocked country located in South Asia. Known as the 'Roof of the World,' it’s renowned for its towering Himalayan peaks, including Mount Everest, and its diverse landscapes ranging from subtropical plains to high-altitude deserts. Nepal boasts a rich cultural heritage, with a blend of Hinduism and Buddhism, and is a popular destination for trekkers, mountaineers, and cultural enthusiasts.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, a vibrant hub of culture, commerce, and history.
quickFacts.detail: Kathmandu is situated in the Kathmandu Valley and is home to numerous ancient temples, palaces, and UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Nepal's population is diverse, with a significant percentage of the population residing in rural areas.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population speaks Nepali, with numerous other languages and dialects spoken throughout the country.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Nepal is a relatively small country, but incredibly diverse in its geography.
quickFacts.detail: It’s the world’s tenth-largest country by area.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally, 1 USD is approximately NPR 130.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Numerous other languages are spoken, including Nepali, Tamang, Tharu, and Newari.

climateData.title: Nepal's Climate
climateData.description: Nepal experiences a diverse range of climates due to its varied topography. The climate varies significantly with altitude, from subtropical in the south to alpine in the Himalayas.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is arguably the best time to visit Nepal, offering pleasant temperatures and clear skies.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the monsoon season in Nepal, characterized by heavy rainfall and cloud cover.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn offers similar conditions to spring, with clear skies and comfortable temperatures, making it a popular trekking season.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter brings cold temperatures and snowfall, particularly in the higher altitudes. Roads to some areas may be closed.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Everest
naturalWonders.description: Mount Everest, the world's highest peak, dominates the skyline of the Himalayas and attracts mountaineers from around the globe. Its majestic presence is a symbol of Nepal's natural grandeur.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located on the border between Nepal and Tibet, Mount Everest’s summit reaches an elevation of 8,848.86 meters (29,031.7 feet). The surrounding Khumbu Glacier is a formidable challenge for climbers.

naturalWonders.name: Pokhara Valley
naturalWonders.description: Pokhara Valley, nestled beside the serene Phewa Lake, offers stunning views of the Annapurna range and a tranquil atmosphere.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The valley is known for its picturesque landscapes, boating opportunities, and vibrant lakeside culture. It’s a popular destination for relaxation and adventure.
viewingTips: Wake up early for sunrise views
Take a boat ride on Phewa Lake

naturalWonders.name: Chitwan National Park
naturalWonders.description: Chitwan National Park is a protected area in the Terai lowlands, renowned for its diverse wildlife, including tigers, rhinos, and elephants.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park offers opportunities for jungle safaris, elephant rides, and bird watching. It plays a crucial role in conserving Nepal’s biodiversity.
viewingTips: Maintain a safe distance from wildlife

scientificData.Biodiversity: Over 600 species of plants and animals

ecosystemData.title: Nepal's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Nepal’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from subtropical forests to alpine meadows and high-altitude deserts. These ecosystems support a rich array of flora and fauna, many of which are endemic to the region.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Nepal’s land area is protected as national parks, wildlife reserves, and conservation areas.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Nepal’s forests cover approximately 40% of the country’s land area and play a vital role in regulating water resources and supporting biodiversity.

statistics.details: Nepal is a hotspot for plant diversity.

notableSpecies.name: Red Panda
notableSpecies.significance: An iconic symbol of Nepal's biodiversity.

notableSpecies.name: Himalayan Blue Poppy
notableSpecies.significance: Known for its vibrant blue color and medicinal properties.

biodiversityCategories.name: Aquatic Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Nepal’s rivers, lakes, and wetlands provide essential habitats for a wide range of aquatic species and support livelihoods for local communities.

statistics.details: Important for flood control and biodiversity.

notableSpecies.name: Mahseer
notableSpecies.significance: A large and important freshwater fish.

activities.title: Activities in Nepal
activities.description: Nepal offers a wide range of activities for travelers of all interests and abilities, from challenging treks to cultural experiences.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Hiking is a popular activity in Nepal, with trails ranging from easy day hikes to multi-day treks through stunning mountain landscapes.

activities.name: Everest Base Camp Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek to the base camp of Mount Everest, offering breathtaking views of the Himalayas.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, trekking boots, warm clothing

activities.name: Annapurna Circuit Trek
activities.description: A classic trek around the Annapurna massif, offering diverse landscapes and cultural experiences.
activities.requirements: Moderate fitness, trekking poles, waterproof gear

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Nepal’s rivers and lakes offer opportunities for various water sports, including rafting, kayaking, and swimming.

activities.name: White Water Rafting on Trisuli River
activities.description: Experience the thrill of rafting on the Trisuli River, known for its exciting rapids.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket and pants, hat, gloves, scarf

equipment.basic: Backpack, water bottle, headlamp, first-aid kit
equipment.hiking: Trekking poles, hiking boots, map, compass
